Hi,

Am Mittwoch, 2. April 2003 18:15 schrieb Vladimir R. Bossicard:
> How do you test that your postcondition is correct?
> So maintaining the postcondition can be as difficult as writing the method
> itself. But I'm not a DBC guru.
>
> I think that you could successfully used DBC and unit testing together.
> Using DBC doesn't imply that you don't unit test the code (idem for the
> contrary).
>
> I'm sure that code using DBC have also bugs, that's why I'm not convinced
> (yet) that DBC is the _only_ method. Just one of many.
I absolutely agree.
Or imagine:
public boolean isSorted(int[] array) {
// ...
}
How do you use DBC to test wether the method correctly returns true/false?

> ps: I like to see the name of the person I'm writing to. (and not
> javainsel@...)
Me too.
